ram.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: to run or drive into something very hard
ram.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: In the latest raid, thieves used his van to ram a police car.
He lost control of his truck and rammed into a van, killing two people.
ram.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to push something into a position, using great force
ram.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: First, youâ€™ll have to ram the posts into the ground.
I rammed my foot down on the brake.
ram.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: a machine that hits something again and again to force it into a position
ram.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: the part of a computer that acts as a temporary store for information so that it can be used immediately
ram.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: a model with 128 MB of RAM
ram.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: random access memory; the memory in a computer system that is used to store information for a short time. The more RAM a computer has, the more software can be used on it at the same time
ram.translation[3].definitions[0].exampl: Programs are getting bigger, requiring more RAM.
The Marixx DS comes with 64 Megabytes of RAM.
